rooms.comm: The rooms are clean, spacious, and well-appointed, providing a comfortable stay.

cont.itemA: The second I walked in the room, I knew that I wasn't going to want to leave and ordered myself some room service. Our room was upgraded upon arrival; we couldn't have asked for more. Our room (#407) was very elegant and quiet, was on the west side of the building, and had windows on 2 walls. The rooms were beautiful and very clean and much larger than we expected from a historical building.
cont.itemB: Rooms were nice and clean; however, a little boring. The rooms are really nice, bathrooms and linen really clean, and above all else, the staff is some of the friendliest I have ever come across.

location.comm: The hotel is located in a central area of Boston, providing easy access to various attractions and amenities.

cont.itemA: The hotel is located right in the heart of Boston next to the Common and a few minutes walk to the waterfront. The possibilities are endless for restaurants and nightlife.
cont.itemB: The hotel is in a great location, very close to Macy's, TJ Maxx, and Marshall's, all within walking distance of other sites we wanted to see. It was in a great location close to the theater district, shopping, etc.

staff_service.comm: The staff are attentive and provide professional service, enhancing the overall guest experience.

cont.itemA: Staff were nothing but attentive and hospitable. The front desk and room service staffs, the concierges, restaurant and in-room breakfasts, and the chauffeured car service were all excellent.
cont.itemB: The staff was great; we were upgraded to a Terrace Suite when we checked in. Great concierges.

dining.comm: Breakfast at the hotel is praised for its quality and is noted to be expensive.

cont.itemA: The hotel breakfast was fantastic, if expensive. Every dish was amazing.
cont.itemB: There were restaurants close by, but it would have been nice to have had the convenience of additional dining places. The breakfast buffet was wonderful as well!

itemA.comfort: The bed is very comfortable, and the fireplace makes it cozy.
itemA.quality: I stayed at this hotel while traveling on business, and it was by far the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. The shower was also fantastic. An elegant, small hotel!
itemA.amenities: The rooftop is a nice touch on a warm day to share a bottle of wine. The fitness center was so so.

itemB.price: It is a pricey hotel, but definitely worth it if you can swing it!
itemB.quality: I have no complaints; the staff was very helpful, and the in-house restaurant was excellent.
itemB.internet: Disappointing that there is a charge for internet, which is a common issue with all hotels.
